thread.section_title: The Inbetweeners could be returning to our screens but not in the way you’d hope – Metro
thread.title: The Inbetweeners could be returning to our screens but not in the way you’d hope
thread.title_full: The Inbetweeners could be returning to our screens but not in the way you’d hope

author: hannahrjlawrence
title: The Inbetweeners could be returning to our screens but not in the way you’d hope
text:
The Inbetweeners might be getting a reboot (Picture: Channel 4) Our four favourite Rudge Park adolescents could be returning to our screens for a new Inbetweeners series. 
The Walking Dead: Andrew Lincoln shares hilarious idea for how the show should end Except there’s a bit of a catch: it won’t star any of the original boys.
Production company, Banijay UK, want to ‘revitalise’ the sitcom but it won’t be Simon Bird, Joe Thomas, Blake Harrison and James Buckley that we’ll be seeing, according to Broadcast .
And it’s basically because the cast are now too old to be playing teenage boys.
Who would have thought.
We won’t be seeing these four again for a while (Picture: Anthony Harvey/Getty Images) The company’s Chief Operating Officer Peter Langenberg said: ‘It’s not feasible for the cast to reprise their roles at that stage of life, but the brand is so strong that I’m definitely interested in seeing if we could take a new spin on it.’
Which we’re pretty sure means Bird, Thomas, Harrison and Buckley are a bit past pretending to be teenagers.
More: TV Great British Bake Off makers say they're 'thrilled' with the new line up 
4 important clues you missed in Iron Fist episode 1 
Prince Harry's girlfriend Meghan Markle 'planning to quit acting' for good 
It’s not just the cast who wouldn’t be returning, the show would need someone to pen the script considering the original writers, Damon Beesley and Iain Morris, have left the production company.
Poor Langenberg is looking increasingly on his own on this one.
Although with three successful series and two movies under their belt, we’re sure there must be plenty of actors desperate to take on the roles of a bunch of awkward teens struggling their way through life.
Who wouldn’t want to star in scenes like this:

Don’t all rush at once.
Love this as much as we do? Like Metro Entertainment on Facebook for more dazzling stories on your news feed.
